course_info:
PHY203: ELEMENTARY PHYSICS I (Fall 2024)

Instructor: Miquel Dorca
Office: 211 East Hall
Email: miquel@uri.edu
Office Hours: MWF 12:30pm - 1:00pm

Course Description:
Calculus-based introduction to Newtonian mechanics. Topics include kinematics and dynamics of particles and systems of particles, conservation laws, rotational motion, gravitation, and oscillatory motion.

Prerequisites:
Credit or concurrent enrollment in MTH 141 and concurrent enrollment in PHY 273.

Intended for:
Science and engineering majors.

Textbook:
University Physics (Open Stax), 1st Edition, Volume 1
Available for free at https://openstax.org/subjects/science.

assignments:
Homework Assignments:
All homework will be administered through WebAssign and are due by 10:00pm on the specified dates. Assignments are typically due on Wednesdays or Fridays.

Homework Schedule:
- Wed., Sept. 11: HW #1 due (Reading: Chapter 1)
- Wed., Sept. 18: HW #2 due (Reading: Sections 3.1-3.5)
- Wed., Sept. 25: HW #3 due (Reading: Sections 2.1-2.3, 4.1-4.3)
- Fri., Oct. 2: HW #4 due (Reading: Chap. 5)
- Fri., Oct. 18: HW #5 due (Reading: Sections 4.4, 6.1-6.3)
- Fri., Oct. 25: HW #6 due (Reading: 1st part of Sec. 2.4, Chap. 7)
- Fri., Nov. 2: HW #7 due (Reading: Chap. 8)
- Wed., Nov. 6: HW #8 due (Reading: Sections 9.1-9.6)
- Wed., Nov. 13: HW #9 due (Reading: 2nd part of Sec. 2.4, Secs. 11-11.3)
- Wed., Dec. 4: HW #10 due (Reading: Sections 13.1-13.5)
- Wed., Dec. 11: HW #11 due (Reading: Sections 15.1, 15.2, 15.4)
- Wed., Dec. 11: HW #12 due (Reading: Sections 15.1, 15.2, 15.4)

Assignment Policies:
- Five submission attempts allowed per assignment.
- After the due date, a 4-day extension with a 10-point penalty is available once per assignment.
- Each student receives a unique set of problem numbers on WebAssign.
- A 2-week free grace period is available for starting assignments.

WebAssign Information:
- Access and purchase at http://webassign.net/student.html
- Class Key: uri1373 1043
- Links:
  - OpenStax/WebAssign: https://webassign.net/features/textbooks/osuniphys1/details.html
  - Pricing: https://www.cengage.com/c/webassign-for-openstax-university-physics-1e-ling/9781337799942/?filterBy=Higher-Education#compare-buying-options
exams:
Examinations:
- Total: Three unit exams and a cumulative final exam.
- Format: All exams are closed book; no resources allowed except calculators. Students may bring one sheet of relevant formulas for each unit exam and three sheets for the final exam.
- Replacement Policy: Scores on the final exam can replace unit exam scores if higher but will not replace if lower.

Exam Schedule:
- Exam #1: Unit 1 (Chapters 1, 3, 4) on Fri., September 27
- Exam #2: Unit 2 (Chapters 5-8) on Fri., October 25
- Exam #3: Unit 3 (Chapters 9-11, 15) on Wed., December 11
- Final Exam: Date TBA (Covers Chapters 1-11, 15)

special_sessions:
Recitations:
- Registration: All students must register for a recitation section of PHY273 separately.
- Location: Room 112
- Contribution to Grade: Up to 250 points as part of PHY203 grade.
- Requirements: Correctly solve 3 problems in each recitation to receive full credit. Solving additional problems can cover missed problems from previous recitations.

Laboratories (PHY273):
- Registration: Must register for two sections of PHY273 (one laboratory section and one recitation section) separately.
- Laboratory Policies:
  - Completion of all seven experiments is mandatory; missing labs result in zero points.
  - One make-up lab available at semester's end for legitimate absences.
  - Lab manual and a durable lab notebook (e.g., National Brand Computation Notebook, Model 43-648) required.

Laboratory Schedule:
1. Intro Lab (9/9-13)
2. Motion in 1D (Free Fall) (9/16-20)
3. Motion in 1D (Analysis) (9/23-27)
4. Motion in 2D (Projectiles) (9/30-10/4)
5. Motion in 2D (Analysis) (10/7-11)
6. Newton's Laws (10/14-18)
7. Conservation of Energy (10/21-25)
8. Collisions (Experimental) (10/28-11/1)
9. Collisions (Analysis) - 2 weeks (11/4-15)
10. Ballistic Pendulum (11/18-22)
11. Rotational Dynamics (12/2-12/6)
12. Make-up Lab (Pendulum) on 12/12 (Reading Day)

Continuation of Elementary Physics:
- PHY204: Electricity and Magnetism
- PHY205: Thermodynamics, Waves, Acoustics, Optics
